page.title: 17SOCIAL CONCERNS BRAISHFIELD
page.content: Efforts to re-establish the village pond have been a recent priority with the Village Association.Specialist clearing and draining are now considered essential,after voluntary efforts to keep the pond in good condition have failed.The parish council are pursuing the establishment of title to the land,in order that a grant toward the cost of this work may be applied for. There being no doctor's surgery in the village is considered to be a great disadvantage,which may result in call- outs for home visits being more frequent. The lack of main banking facilities also causes some comment,a journey to Romsey being necessary. A poor bus service,just 3 journeys a day,is the result of the axeing of an un-economic service.
